description: The heat wave in the U.S. is far from over. This weekend, parts of the Pacific Northwest and Northeast are bearing the brunt of the heat with record-breaking temperatures.
title: Extreme heat grips West and East coasts, breaking daily highs

description: NPR's Scott Simon remembers screenwriter Robert Towne, who died this week. Towne won an Oscar for Chinatown, which is considered one of the best screenplays in American cinema.
title: Opinion: Remembering the star screenwriter Robert Towne

description: This year's Smithsonian Folklife Festival featured "Indigenous Voices of the Americas" and was full of surprises — like Bolivian women skateboarding in traditional garb — bowler hats and poofy skirts.
title: Skateboarders, weavers, kite makers: A Smithsonian party for 'Indigenous voices'

description: After battering Mexico’s Yucatan Peninsula, Beryl moved back into the warm waters of the Gulf of Mexico where it was expected to regain hurricane strength Saturday.
title: Beryl churns in the Gulf of Mexico as Texas braces for a potential hit
